title: Mission Description
content: Nikadorinvoked the Body of a Hundred Deaths to temper blades, aiming to swing the Blade of Fury to pierce the distantOkhema. In this moment of crisis,Mydeiheld off Nikador alone, giving the rest of the party a chance to return to Okhema and strategize a way to counter this threat.

speaker: Phainon
line: We're back.

speaker: Trianne
line: Hnngh... Tired... and dizzy... Will De be okay?

speaker: Phainon
line: He'll be fine... Mydeimos is the fiercest warrior I know.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Something Mydei was born with. A blessing and a curse—the true mark of a Chrysos Heir .

text: How long do you think he'll hold out for...?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Until our return. I'm sure of it.

children.text: What's this indestructible body about?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Something Mydei was born with. A blessing and a curse—the true mark of a Chrysos Heir.

speaker: Phainon
line: Go get some rest, Trianne. We might need your help again before you know it.

speaker: Trianne
line: Okay... Don't worry about me! Take care of yourselves, too...

speaker: Phainon
line: ▶ Let's go, ( Trailblazer )... It's a race against time. We have to find Aglaea right away.

speaker: Aglaea
line: They're back.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Are you okay? Are you injured? Things didn't sound good in Phainon's message.

speaker: Phainon
line: Aglaea— Wait, where's Tribbie?

speaker: Aglaea
line: She began making the necessary preparations the moment we got your message.

speaker: Phainon
line: The city's citizens are enjoying themselves like it's any other day... Do you not see this as a crisis?

speaker: Aglaea
line: Okhema would be in constant turmoil if we were to raise the alert each time danger befell us. Silently eliminating threats and sparing them from living under the shadow of fear — that is the duty of the Chrysos Heirs.

speaker: Phainon
line: I don't see things this way... but now's not the time for arguments.

speaker: Phainon
line: The Blade of Fury has its aim trained on Kephale 's heart. We need to stop the mad Titan , or the entirety of the holy city could be reduced to ash.

speaker: Phainon
line: But Nikador has crafted an indestructible body for himself, one that can't be entirely destroyed. Mydei is buying us time... We need to cherish every second he's fought for.

speaker: Aglaea
line: You're willing yourself to stay calm, Phainon. That's commendable progress.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Castrum Kremnos has been shrouded in the fog far too long, leaving us unable to discover the mystery behind Nikador 's undying body.

speaker: Aglaea
line: ...We can only hope to learn the truth from one Titan.

speaker: Phainon
line: You mean...

speaker: Castorice
line: Lord Phainon, I will join you in the audience with Oronyx . Let's hope they can restore the visions of the past and reveal the truth behind Nikador 's defiance of death.

speaker: Phainon
line: You have no clue either, Miss Castorice?

speaker: Castorice
line: Strife and Death used to be inseparable. Nikador valued honor in their glory days, so they would never have betrayed their allies back then.

speaker: Castorice
line: But their pact was broken when Nikador descended into madness. From what we know so far... in the pursuit of an immortal body, Nikador betrayed Death .

speaker: Phainon
line: There's one other thing. We found a slate in Kremnos that mentioned an infiltration...

speaker: Aglaea
line: Don't worry about that. Tribbie and I will do our best to protect the people of our holy city.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Focus on getting to Oronyx and using whatever means possible to learn the mad Titan's secrets.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Tribbie is waiting for you outside the city — go with her to the Abyss. I will pray to Kephale that you will find success.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Tribbie is waiting for you outside the city — go with her to the Abyss. I will pray to Kephale that you will find success.

text: Head with Tribbie to the Abyss of Fate

title: Step Description
content: Castorice realizes that Nikador's immortality is rooted in a betrayal of Death itself. To unravel the mystery hidden in the past, we must journey to the Abyss and borrow the power of Oronyx to replicate the past.

speaker: Phainon
line: Tribbie! We're ready to set off.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Okay, we've been updated on what has happened. Let us send you into the Abyss this time.

speaker: Phainon
line: Are you sure? It's always been Trianne doing this...

speaker: Tribbie
line: The two trips to and from Castrum Kremnos have completely drained Trianne. She'll need some time to recover.

speaker: Tribbie
line: We can handle this, Snowy ... This is as much for De as it is for everyone else.

speaker: Castorice
line: High Priest Tribbie... Do you have any suggestions on how we can get Oronyx to respond to us later?

speaker: Tribbie
line: Sorry... We wish we could help, Cas , but Oronyx has never been a Titan to chat or interact with humans.

speaker: Castorice
line: I suppose... we'll have to rely on ourselves, then.

text: But don't they let us use their power?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: It's one thing to use their powers and another to be aligned with us in war. If that Titan refuses to be on our side... we'll have to resort to a fight.

text: Sounds like we're leaving it up to luck...

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: If that Titan refuses to be on our side... we'll have to resort to a fight.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Oronyx ... isn't an evil Titan at heart. Let us hope things won't reach that point.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Time is of the essence, everyone... We should get going.

speaker: Tribbie
line: This is it! The Century Gate can only take you this far.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Although the Temple of the Three Fates has been abandoned for a long time, the magical barriers woven by the priests still linger around it. Approaching with Janus 's power recklessly could be extremely risky.

speaker: Phainon
line: We understand. Thank you, Tribbie.

speaker: Tribbie
line: We have to go back to Okhema to help Aglaea. Snowy and Cas, we trust you know how to summon us when you're done.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Here, keep this with you. This token is proof of a Janus priest . Hold it up to the Gate of Infinity, and you'll be able to walk through unimpeded.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Take care, alright? May Kephale light your path forward.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: We're on our own now.

speaker: Phainon
line: Important decisions will be waiting for us every step of the way. What we're about to do will not only determine Mydei's fate... but also that of every single resident in Okhema.

speaker: Phainon
line: The Temple of the Three Fates is behind the Gate of Infinity, and Oronyx is at the very heart of this temple. We're going to have to find Oronyx and convince them to help us in our battle.

speaker: Castorice
line: May everything go well for us...

title: Step Description
content: Castorice realizes that Nikador's immortality is rooted in a betrayal of Death itself. To unravel the mystery hidden in the past, we must journey to the Abyss and borrow the power of Oronyx to replicate the past.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: This is the path we took when we first arrived.

speaker: Phainon
line: It is... The world seems to have plummeted to its end in the blink of an eye.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Are these... the ruins we saw when we first arrived? They look... somewhat different.
*incomprehensible speech*

speaker: Dan Heng
line: What was that?

speaker: Castorice
line: I believe that was a Titan speaking... I believe it was Oronyx .

speaker: Castorice
line: I have to listen closely to what they are saying...

speaker: Titan's Voice
line: *Titan's murmurs*

speaker: Castorice
line: "Devious and repulsive humans... Are you here to disturb my peace again, just as disaster approaches?"

text: You know what the Titan is saying?
How can you understand without subtitles?

speaker: Phainon
line: Miss Castorice can understand the Titans' words . That's exactly why we need her on this trip.

speaker: Titan's Voice
line: *Titan's murmurs*

speaker: Castorice
line: "Cease your efforts... and let yourself be swallowed by the confusion of time and space..."

speaker: Phainon
line: Oronyx is turning us away? It seems like we've hit an obstacle on the very first step.

speaker: Castorice
line: Could the Titan have created this chaotic scene we see in these ruins as a barrier to hinder us?

speaker: Phainon
line: We'll overcome any obstacle, no matter what they throw at us.

speaker: Phainon
line: Tribbie gave us a demonstration when we had to pass through here the last time... It's up to us to recreate these miracles now.

text: Use the Titan Miracle to switch space-time

speaker: Titan's Voice
line: *Titan's murmurs*

speaker: Castorice
line: "Curse you mortals... curse your pride and your merciless ways."

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ "Lift the curtain of memory..."

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ "...and once again stir the ripples of past reverie!"

text: Interact with Tome of Miracles to allow the Trailblazer to traverse between two different space-time positions. Interact with Tome of Miracles to allow the Trailblazer to traverse between two different space-time positions. Between two different space-time positions, objects such as roads, obstacles, mechanisms, and treasures may appear differently. Main road differences and key objectives are presented in the current space-time positions as golden memory dust , which can be observed to predict their appearance in another space-time position Between two different space-time positions, objects such as roads, obstacles, mechanisms, and treasures may appear differently. Main road differences and key objectives are presented in the current space-time positions as golden memory dust , which can be observed to predict their appearance in another space-time position

speaker: Titan's Voice
line: *Titan's murmurs*

speaker: Castorice
line: Oronyx is saying something again...

speaker: Castorice
line: "...Who are you to command me? Does your inhumanity know no end?"

speaker: Phainon
line: Are we... actually forcing the Titans to do our bidding with these miracles?

speaker: Phainon
line: We can't afford to stop and think about that right now. Let's press on.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ...It won't open?

speaker: Castorice
line: Perhaps... this gate only opens in the right time dimension?

text: In Amphoreus, some doors can only be opened in specific space-time positions. Sun-marked doors can only be opened during the day, and moon-marked doors can only be opened in the evernight. In Amphoreus, some doors can only be opened in specific space-time positions. Sun-marked doors can only be opened during the day, and moon-marked doors can only be opened in the evernight. Yellow light patterns on the door means the door can be opened in the current space-time position. White light patterns on the door means the door cannot be opened in the current space-time position. Yellow light patterns on the door means the door can be opened in the current space-time position. White light patterns on the door means the door cannot be opened in the current space-time position.

speaker: Phainon
line: There! Those Miracle Orbs are instruments often used by Time Priests. They could prove handy.

text: The light from the Miracle Orb will transform the illuminated area into another space-time . The light from the Miracle Orb will transform the illuminated area into another space-time . Use the Switch button in the bottom-right corner to switch on or off the orbs' light . Use the Quit button to exit the control interface of the orbs . Use the Switch button in the bottom-right corner to switch on or off the orbs' light . Use the Quit button to exit the control interface of the orbs .

speaker: Phainon
line: Look, an inverse time dimension is reflected by those orbs.

speaker: Phainon
line: Let's summon another miracle. Perhaps this time we'll make it through.

text: Use the Titan Miracle to switch space-time

No matter which space-time you're currently in, the orb's light will continuously reveal the other space-time . No matter which space-time you're currently in, the orb's light will continuously reveal the other space-time . After shining the orb's light to a specific location , try to traverse the space-time via the Tome of Miracles. There might be new discoveries to be found. After shining the orb's light to a specific location , try to traverse the space-time via the Tome of Miracles. There might be new discoveries to be found.
Head to the Temple of the Three Fates

speaker: Phainon
line: Great. Should be smooth sailing from here.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: At last, we're out... That place was in total disarray.

speaker: Castorice
line: The distorted time and space... is likely a reflection of Oronyx 's own twisted struggles.

text: (Take a detour to the landing car's crash site, optional)

speaker: Castorice
line: Is that...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ▶ This is where we crash-landed. (Trailblazer) and I nearly died when our car was assaulted.

speaker: Phainon
line: Upon reflection, that was probably Nikador 's doing, too.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: This gate looks just as magnificent up close.

speaker: Castorice
line: The Gate of Infinity. It represents the divine power of Janus . According to legend, Janus is the eldest of the Three Titans of Fate. They created the "space" of Amphoreus.

speaker: Castorice
line: But the Titan has long fallen and surrendered their Coreflame. Tribbie is the demigod that inherited their divinity.

text: How did Tribbie defeat a Titan...?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Brute force isn't the only option. Some Titans can also be vanquished... other ways.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: But that doesn't mean Tribbie isn't powerful enough... She's one of Amphoreus' most revered heroes.

text: I didn't realize she was that strong.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Brute force isn't the only option. Some Titans can also be vanquished... other ways.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: But you're not wrong, strength is no measure for how powerful Tribbie is. She's one of Amphoreus' most revered heroes.

speaker: Phainon
line: Let's go. With Tribbie's token, we should be able to go straight into the Temple of the Three Fates.

speaker: Titan's Voice
line: *Titan's murmurs*

speaker: Castorice
line: ...Please pardon me. Words this vile should not be relayed.

speaker: Phainon
line: It's not going to be easy getting Oronyx 's help.

speaker: Phainon
line: This temple has been forsaken for so long that we have no way of telling what dangers await us behind this gate. From the way Oronyx spoke to us in the ruins, I won't count on her being cordial toward us.

speaker: Titan's Voice
line: *Titan's murmurs*

text: We need a translation for that.

speaker: Castorice
line: "Venture no closer... Keep out."

speaker: Castorice
line: "You won't find anything you desire here... Save for despair and demise."

speaker: Phainon
line: Is that you, Oronyx ?

speaker: Phainon
line: Forgive me, but if you refuse to help us, then despair and demise will be all that's left on this world!

text: Phainon raises the stone talisman of Janus ...
...The sound of heavy mechanisms comes from the Temple of the Three Fates.

speaker: Titan's Voice
line: *Titan's murmurs*

speaker: Castorice
line: "You are not welcome here... You have no right."

speaker: Castorice
line: "You'll never pass my challenge."

speaker: Phainon
line: A challenge? Great, at least they're willing to speak to us now. Even if they are only making things difficult for us.

speaker: Phainon
line: Push onward, my friends. But watch your step.

title: Step Description
content: We successfully entered the Temple of the Three Fates. However, Oronyx does not welcome our presence and complicates our path with various puzzles, blocking us from reaching the temple's deeper chambers.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: The silence is deafening.

speaker: Castorice
line: This place... isn't as I knew it.

speaker: Phainon
line: The Scales of Justice. It's my first time seeing it in its full glory.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Is this also a symbol of a certain Titan?

speaker: Castorice
line: Talanton , the second of the Three Titans of Fate. They were said to have created the laws that govern our world.

speaker: Castorice
line: Talanton surrendered their Coreflame, though the Chrysos Heir taking over their legacy is... nowhere to be found today.

speaker: Phainon
line: At least the laws that govern our world are still in place. So that demigod must be performing their duty still, no matter where they are.

speaker: Phainon
line: There's no exit in sight. How do we proceed?

speaker: Titan's Voice
line: *Titan's murmurs*

speaker: Castorice
line: "Leave... leave."

speaker: Castorice
line: Stay away from my sister's property. Leave...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: "Sister"...?

speaker: Castorice
line: There are also people who describe the Three Titans of Fates to be "siblings." I think they mean Talanton 's scales.

speaker: Phainon
line: Neither of these are paths we can take, and the exit has been concealed from us. Looks like Oronyx is bent on keeping us out.

speaker: Phainon
line: The Tome of Miracles... We'll just have to try our luck with this, then.

text: Try using the Tome of Miracles to repair the scales

speaker: Titan's Voice
line: *Titan's murmurs*

speaker: Castorice
line: "Hurts... it hurts... so much."

speaker: Phainon
line: Does performing a miracle really... subject them to that much pain?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Look, the broken scales have been restored to their full form.

speaker: Titan's Voice
line: *Titan's murmurs*

speaker: Castorice
line: "No... You cannot... You must not come any closer."

speaker: Titan's Voice
line: *Titan's murmurs*

speaker: Castorice
line: "The scales are as much an entrance... as they are a challenge."

speaker: Phainon
line: The scales...? Are they expecting us to balance it?

speaker: Castorice
line: I believe so...

speaker: Phainon
line: ...Are you alright, Miss Castorice?

speaker: Castorice
line: I—I'm fine. It's just... I can feel Oronyx 's misery.

speaker: Phainon
line: Being able to understand the Titans' words is as much an affliction as it is a gift. Let's get this over and done with.

text: Use the Scales of Justice in the map to complete Oronyx's test. Use the Scales of Justice in the map to complete Oronyx's test. Control the Hand of Zagreus to find and take the appropriately weighted items available in the map, then place them on the plate on the right side of the scale to try to solve Oronyx's puzzle. Control the Hand of Zagreus to find and take the appropriately weighted items available in the map, then place them on the plate on the right side of the scale to try to solve Oronyx's puzzle.

speaker: Phainon
line: There's an abandoned Hand of Zagreus here. Let's use it.

text: Firstly, try to pass Oronyx's trial with the Hand of Zagreus.
(Approach the Hand of Zagreus control platform)

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Does that Titan really intend to deter us with a challenge like this?

speaker: Castorice
line: What do you mean, Mr. Dan Heng?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: This doesn't make sense to me. Oronyx thinks of us as intruders, so isn't it far easier for them to forcefully stop us with their divine powers?

speaker: Castorice
line: Oronyx ... based on my understanding, isn't the kind that resorts to brutality.

text: It seems that the weights have been blessed by the Titans and cannot be seized by the Hand of Zagreus.

speaker: Phainon
line: Does this mean we've passed the challenge?

speaker: Phainon
line: Oronyx ! We completed your challenge. Can you let us pass now?

speaker: Titan's Voice
line: *Titan's murmurs*

speaker: Castorice
line: "No... Unsatisfactory... You cannot pass."

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Looks like this Titan doesn't like to keep their promises.

speaker: Titan's Voice
line: *Titan's murmurs*

speaker: Castorice
line: "Another... challenge. Must deter... the mortals."

speaker: Phainon
line: Are they just stalling for time? We don't have the time for games...

speaker: Titan's Voice
line: *Titan's murmurs*

speaker: Castorice
line: "Weights in the left weighing pan... represent the fate of Amphoreus."

speaker: Castorice
line: "Find... something that weighs more... and place it in the right pan..."

speaker: Castorice
line: "Find something that has more weight... than the fate of the world."

speaker: Castorice
line: They seem somewhat fickle, much like... a child.

speaker: Phainon
line: Something that has more weight than the fate of the world? That's a baffling riddle.

text: (Some dialogue was removed from this section inVersion 3.2.)

speaker: Phainon
line: Look, behind that gate. Isn't that the exact same type of weight?

speaker: Phainon
line: If we can use it to balance the scales and add more weight to the pan, we might be able to solve Oronyx 's riddle.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: My intuition says this won't be that easy... But I suppose we don't have any better solutions at the moment.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: If that Titan is truly so childlike, maybe they're just playing with us. In that case, let's play along until they're satisfied.

text: Try to retrieve the weight behind the fence
(Place a weight on the scale, optional)

speaker: Dan Heng
line: No movement at all... Not the right item.

speaker: Titan's Voice
line: *Titan's murmurs*

speaker: Castorice
line: "Obtuse... blind fools..."

speaker: Phainon
line: ...They really know how to get under someone's skin.

text: (Place a weight on the scale again, optional)

speaker: Phainon
line: This won't do... We're just wasting our time.

speaker: Titan's Voice
line: *Titan's murmurs*

speaker: Castorice
line: I don't think there's a need for me to convey any words that'll only irritate you further.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: There's an obstacle ahead.

speaker: Castorice
line: Perhaps the Miracle Orbs can illuminate the way forward.

text: Some orbs can shine at one of the multiple selectable areas . After activating the orb, ( click click on PC / tap tap on mobile / press press on Controller ) the yellow circular marking on the screen to change the direction of the orb. Some orbs can shine at one of the multiple selectable areas . After activating the orb, ( click click on PC / tap tap on mobile / press press on Controller ) the yellow circular marking on the screen to change the direction of the orb.

speaker: Phainon
line: There, a Prophecy Tablet. It could be the key to unlocking the way.

speaker: Phainon
line: Everything's going well... so far.

speaker: Phainon
line: There are also stone platforms for the Hand of Zagreus all around. This will save us the trouble of doubling back.

text: Try using the same weights to balance the scales
(Place the specified weight on the scale)

speaker: Phainon
line: It worked! Now, the scales have once again been balanced.

speaker: Titan's Voice
line: *Titan's murmurs*

speaker: Castorice
line: "Futile attempts... Give up... give up."

speaker: Phainon
line: We've played along with you for long enough. It's time you admitted defeat, Oronyx !

speaker: Phainon
line: Let's go and complete their challenge.

speaker: Castorice
line: "Find something that has more weight... than the fate of the world."

text: Find something that has more weight than the "Fate of the World"

speaker: Titan's Voice
line: *Titan's murmurs*

speaker: Castorice
line: "You think that you've won? Arrogant... Foolish..."

speaker: Phainon
line: Titan, are you still trying to hold out?

speaker: Phainon
line: We just have to make the weighing pan on this side drop, right?

speaker: Phainon
line: Let's think about it... It shouldn't be that difficult.

text: Place the flaming lance and the baseball bat on it.

children.text: You place the flaming lance and the bat on the scale's tray...

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: It didn't even move an inch...

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: ▶ I've held (Trailblazer)'s flaming lance before and it's quite heavy. Seems like this isn't going to work.

children.speaker: Titan's Voice
children.line: *Titan's murmurs*

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: Oronyx ... is mocking us.

children.text: (Return to previous options with this option removed)
You dexterously leap onto the scale's tray…

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: ...Have you thought of gaining some weight?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: ▶ Come down, (Trailblazer)... Seems like this isn't going to work.

children.text: (Return to previous options with this option removed)
You swing the baseball bat hard at the scale's tray...
...But it doesn't budge. And your arm feel numb from the strong recoil.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: ▶ ( Mr. / Miss ) (Trailblazer)? Are you feeling alright?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: It seems like we can't rely on brute force to clear this challenge.

children.text: (Return to previous options with this option removed)

text: I give up! Just let me pass!

children.text: (Continue to next section)

speaker: Titan's Voice
line: *Titan's murmurs*

speaker: Phainon
line: What did they say, Castorice?

speaker: Castorice
line: Oronyx is frustrated... Because we're treating their challenge like a game.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Which means that we have to find something that literally has more weight than the fate of Amphoreus? It sounds like an impossible task.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: For the people of Amphoreus, is there really anything that has more weight than this land? They don't even have the option to flee beyond the sky.

speaker: Phainon
line: Something that has more weight than the fate of the world...

speaker: Castorice
line: ...No, Lord Phainon.

speaker: Castorice
line: There must be some other way... A more comprehensive way. Even if our time is tight...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ▶ (Trailblazer), I've got it.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ▶ (Trailblazer), hand me March's camera.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Indeed, for the people of Amphoreus, the fate of the world is a weight that is far too heavy.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ▶ But perhaps even the Titan did not expect that... For outsiders like (Trailblazer) and I, we still have not yet become fully involved with the fate of this world.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: From our perspective, there is something even more important than this world — or perhaps even the entire cosmos.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: And that's the companions that we have traveled with.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: If this indeed is the case, we will have passed the Titan's challenge.

text: Leave the room and meet Oronyx

title: Step Description
content: An item heavier than the "Fate of the World"... We adopted a tricky method and used March 7th's camera to solve this puzzle.

speaker: Phainon
line: ▶ That was an unexpected solution... Thankfully, we had Dan Heng and (Trailblazer) here with us.

speaker: Titan's Voice
line: *Titan's murmurs*

speaker: Castorice
line: I think that even Oronyx themself is surprised that we managed to clear the challenge.

speaker: Phainon
line: At least they kept their promise and opened the path for an audience.

speaker: Titan's Voice
line: *Titan's murmurs*

speaker: Phainon
line: This...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: It feels like a cold wave is seeping into the mind, and a hand with countless fingers is churning through my memories.

speaker: Castorice
line: Maybe people who have led wonderful lives would enjoy such an intrusion...

text: Have an audience with Oronyx, Veil of Evernight

title: Step Description
content: We arrived at Oronyx's residence, but they refused to offer any assistance. In a desperate attempt to save Mydei, Phainon was preprared to take drastic measures.

speaker: Phainon
line: Oronyx !

speaker: Titan's Voice
line: *Titan's murmurs*

speaker: Castorice
line: "Leave... leave."

speaker: Phainon
line: Help us, Titan! Help us prevent this world from being ruined by madness!

speaker: Titan's Voice
line: *Titan's murmurs*

speaker: Castorice
line: "Refuse... refuse."

speaker: Dan Heng
line: A Titan who still possesses reason... both mysterious and awe-inspiring.

text: I really want to take a photo of them.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: I understand, such a spectacle is rare to witness.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: The Titans all have vastly different physical forms, with some of them even abandoning their physical shell.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: Not every Titan is as violent as Nikador ... They weren't always like that either.

speaker: Phainon
line: "I have crossed the myriad passages and been judged by the scales."

speaker: Phainon
line: "It has deemed me innocent and granted me fruits." — O mighty Oronyx . We plead for your assistance!

speaker: Phainon
line: The madness of Nikador is pushing Amphoreus toward the end times. They have abandoned their honor, replicating themself through crazed means, and are fully intending to destroy the sky father and the civilization they protect.

speaker: Phainon
line: Please reveal to us the past that has been shrouded in fog and guide us to a way to quench this madness!

speaker: Titan's Voice
line: *Titan's murmurs*

speaker: Castorice
line: "Chrysos Heirs... Heroes that uphold rage, cruelty, and darkness..."

speaker: Castorice
line: "Pursuing the cursed prophecy... You've treated my kind as prey..."

speaker: Castorice
line: "In the name of deliverance, you would seize my Coreflame... and leave me to suffer in endless isolation..."

speaker: Castorice
line: "Leave... Just leave. Even if the world will be destroyed as a result... I will not help a group of ruthless butchers."

speaker: Phainon
line: I see... God-slayers asking their prey for assistance is a hypocritical act indeed.

speaker: Phainon
line: Then, I can only apologize as we're running out of time... If we're unable to positively conclude our negotiation, you leave me no choice but to take your Coreflame and search through the past locked within it.

speaker: Titan's Voice
line: *Titan's murmurs*

speaker: Castorice
line: Phainon...

speaker: Phainon
line: Castorice, our hesitation is just cruelty to Mydei. How many lives must he have lost already?

speaker: Phainon
line: My apologies, Oronyx ...

speaker: Titan's Voice
line: *Titan's murmurs*

speaker: Castorice
line: Wait... Oronyx 's reaction is a little strange.

speaker: Castorice
line: Titan, what are you muttering about? I can't make it out clearly...

speaker: Titan's Voice
line: *Titan's murmurs*

speaker: Castorice
line: "Mother... Mother?"

speaker: Castorice
line: ▶ ( Mr. / Miss ) (Trailblazer), could you please step forward? Oronyx seems to be calling out for you.

speaker: Titan's Voice
line: *Titan's murmurs*

speaker: Castorice
line: "Mother? Mother..."

speaker: Phainon
line: What exactly... is going on?

speaker: Castorice
line: "Is that you... Is that you? Mother... encountered you. She misses you..."

speaker: Castorice
line: "Follow me... Please follow me. I see you... She also misses you. We want to see everything about you."

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ▶ Is that Titan extending an invitation to (Trailblazer)?

speaker: Castorice
line: I don't understand either. But if this means that Oronyx is willing to establish a connection with us, maybe it'll be worth a try.

speaker: Castorice
line: ▶ ( Mr. / Miss ) (Trailblazer), please consider carefully...

speaker: Titan's Voice
line: *Titan's murmurs*

children.speaker: Titan's Voice
children.line: *Titan's murmurs*

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: "Come with me... Follow me and join me... as we look far into your past..."

children.text: (Continue to next section)

children.speaker: Titan's Voice
children.line: *Titan's murmurs*

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: "Waiting... Hate waiting..."

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: ▶ (Trailblazer), if you do plan to accept their invitation... it's best that you don't let them wait for too long.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ▶ (Trailblazer), if you do plan to accept their invitation... it's best that you don't let them wait for too long.

speaker: Castorice
line: ▶ ( Mr. / Miss ) (Trailblazer), please consider carefully...

title: Step Description
content: We arrived at Oronyx's residence, but they refused to offer any assistance. In a desperate attempt to save Mydei, Phainon was prepared to take drastic measures. Just as the sword was being drawn, Oronyx's demeanor shifted upon noticing (Trailblazer).

speaker: Titan's Voice
line: *Titan's murmurs*

children.speaker: Titan's Voice
children.line: *Titan's murmurs*

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: "Come with me... Follow me and join me... as we look far into your past..."

children.text: (Enter Exploratory ExcursionNight Veil, Shroud the Silent Past)

children.speaker: Titan's Voice
children.line: *Titan's murmurs*

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: "Waiting... Hate waiting..."

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: (Trailblazer), if you do plan to accept their invitation... it's best that you don't let them wait for too long.

title: Step Description
content: According to (Trailblazer), Oronyx showed(him/her)the Stellaron Hunters... It was a memory that should not exist, yet it seems so vivid and realistic.

text: Media:Trailblaze Mission Night Veil, Shroud the Silent Past.mp4

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ It's you again...

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ Where do you want to take me?
It's you. It's me. Where? With you.

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ You want to look into... my memories?
Memories. Yours. Look into? Curious.
Future? Past. Observe. Secrets...

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ This is... the Express ?

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ Is this... a memory?
Where? Here.

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ It's that voice again... Let's follow it.

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ Is that... me?

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ There's also Himeko and Dan Heng... What memory is this?

speaker: Himeko?
line: ...We've got a decent harvest this time. Although we deviated slightly from the "script," it's not a big deal.

speaker: Himeko?
line: ▶ Thanks for your hard work, (Trailblazer). I'm very glad that you're not hurt.

speaker: Himeko?
line: Heh... Not going to share what's on your mind? Traveling with two quiet people really makes the trip feel a little lonely.

speaker: (Trailblazer)?
line: ▶ ...I'm hungry.

speaker: Himeko?
line: Is this really the only time you'll say something? Come on, dinner is ready.

speaker: Dan Heng?
line: ...If possible, can we not have Beef Offal Stew for once?

speaker: Himeko?
line: Why? You don't like the taste of home?

speaker: Dan Heng?
line: I dislike the gamey taste of offal.

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ What's going on...? Are these really my memories?

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ I have no recollection of this conversation at all... Himeko and Dan Heng's tone also seem different. What exactly is going on...?
Memory. Forgotten, chaotic.
We. Confusion, uncover.

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ Kafka... Blade !?

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ No, these aren't my memories... There must have been some mistake.
Memories, discrepancies? Correct. Truth.
Depths, hidden. Forgotten. Forgotten...

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ Another set of nonexistent memories... This time, Sam 's also here.

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ Getting to know myself from a different perspective... feels a little strange.

speaker: Kafka
line: ▶ Do you have any dietary restrictions, (Trailblazer)?

speaker: (Trailblazer)?
line: ▶ I'll eat anything.

speaker: Kafka
line: You really aren't picky about food.

speaker: Sam
line: ▶ The "script" turned out to be extremely dangerous. It's only because of (Trailblazer)'s quick thinking that we managed to escape.

speaker: Sam
line: Dancing on the razor's edge all the time, it's only a matter of time before disaster catches up with us... Kafka.

speaker: Kafka
line: I accept your criticism, Sam. Indeed... Because of the "script," I failed to consider the possibility of failure.

speaker: Kafka
line: I suppose even Stellaron Hunters could use a retreat signal to respond to dire circumstances.

speaker: Kafka
line: There's no time like the present. Why don't we come up with one right now?

speaker: Sam
line: I'll leave it to you.

speaker: Kafka
line: Bladie?

speaker: Blade
line: "Three of a kind..."

speaker: Blade
line: "Two pair..."

speaker: Blade
line: "Ace."

speaker: Kafka
line: Ah... It reeks of Xianzhou . Aren't you afraid you'll be bound by your past?

speaker: Blade
line: It's just a passphrase from the past... No matter. There won't be a need for us to use it.

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (It's the first time that the Express has felt so unfamiliar...)

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (I want to take a look in the Parlor Car...)

speaker: Kafka
line: Three of a kind, two pair, ace...

speaker: Kafka
line: What a catchy yet refined catchphrase.

speaker: Sam
line: Remember to recite this a few more times in your mind the next time you're toying with your prey.

speaker: Kafka
line: When did you become so ruthless?

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ Just what is going on...

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ These memories obviously don't exist in my mind... But they feel so real that I cannot dispute them.

text: Speak with the Stellaron Hunters in the Non-Existent Memory
Firefly turns to you, her expression slightly different from the girl you remember — more melancholic, more profound.

speaker: Firefly
line: ▶ (Trailblazer)... Can I help you?

speaker: Firefly
line: What's wrong? You seem... very nervous.

speaker: Firefly
line: Don't worry, the dust will eventually settle. Let's go through the "script" one more time...

text: Nonexistent memories begin to cool, frost... then freeze.
Firefly turns away, ignoring your call.
Silver Wolf looks up at you, her eyes filled with impatience. You've never spoken with her outside of a hologram — meeting this genius hacker face-to-face is quite novel.

speaker: Silver Wolf
line: ...What's up? I'm in a raid and don't have time for small talk.

text: How did I join you guys?
Stop playing and tell me the truth!

speaker: Silver Wolf
line: Oh... I've only just joined recently. If you have questions, can't you just ask Kafka?

speaker: Silver Wolf
line: Anyway, online games cannot be paused. So, if you don't mind.

text: I'm just worried you'll become addicted.
Nonexistent memories begin to cool, frost... then freeze.
Silver Wolf looks down, ignoring your call.
Kafka turns to look at you, her face showing that familiar smile — half cold, half warm.

speaker: Kafka
line: ▶ What's the matter, (Trailblazer)?

children.speaker: Kafka
children.line: ...Explanation?

text: Why did I forget about you?

children.speaker: Kafka
children.line: ...Forget?

speaker: Kafka
line: ▶ (Trailblazer), did I do something that made you unhappy?

speaker: Kafka
line: We're partners, and I don't want anything to come between us — not even doubt.

speaker: Kafka
line: I think...

text: Nonexistent memories begin to cool, frost... then freeze.
Kafka turns away, ignoring your call.
Blade's glance brushes over your face, leaving a burning trail. In your limited encounters with him, you've never seen such... a calm and logical look in his eyes.

speaker: Blade
line: What's wrong?

text: Why am I with you guys?

speaker: Blade
line: Guided by the "script," we've assembled here to temporarily accomplish a common goal... That's all.

speaker: Blade
line: I don't care about anything else.

speaker: Blade
line: I'll give you one piece of advice — don't let Kafka down. She sacrificed a lot to keep you here... furthermore...

text: Nonexistent memories begin to cool, frost... then freeze.
Blade turns away, ignoring your call.

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ I don't understand... What's the point of all of this?
Happiness... sealed away...
Mother... Are you still there?
Are you watching?

text: ...I can understand what you're saying now?

speaker: Oronyx
line: Memories flowing in reverse... Pounding.

speaker: Oronyx
line: Outside the window... Remember. Look outside the window.

children.speaker: Oronyx
children.line: Sky father... are you watching?

text: Did I unlock a new Path just like that!?

line: You are? I am... Who?
Gaze, watching. Outside, cold.
You... warm. Me like, warmth.

text: All of this does not make sense...
Can anyone explain this to me?

line: Confusion... Same. Answer, unknown.

speaker: Oronyx
line: I've finally found it... Precious memory. At long last... I've caught THEIR gaze.

speaker: Oronyx
line: ▶ Accompany ( him, / her, ) Mem ...

speaker: Oronyx
line: ▶ ( He / She ) will make the memories of this world complete once again... ( He / She ) will find... Mother...

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: Name? Mine? Don't remember.

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: Mem... Address. Temporarily.

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: Mother? Who? Don't remember.

children.text: Is your name "Mem"?

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: Name? Mine? Don't remember.

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: Mem... Address. For now.

speaker: Mem
line: Travel, like. With you, together?

speaker: Mem
line: Memory... collected. Piece together, complete.

speaker: Mem
line: Ador... Nik? Titan?

speaker: Mem
line: Need, memories. Help... I can.

text: As long as you're able to help.

speaker: Oronyx
line: Shadow in the memory...

speaker: Oronyx
line: They... are your companions?

text: I also can't say for sure...

speaker: Mem
line: Bad people. Troublesome. Help, needed.

speaker: Mem
line: Together... Friend?

speaker: Silver Wolf
line: ▶ You're finally here, (Trailblazer).

speaker: Sam
line: ▶ I knew you wouldn't miss this, (Trailblazer).

speaker: Blade
line: ▶ The script says, "Leave no survivors." ...(Trailblazer).

speaker: Kafka
line: ▶ I'm glad to have you here, (Trailblazer).

speaker: Kafka
line: This path is anything but smooth... it's marked by flames, scars, malice, and bloodshed. But I guarantee, as long as you stand with the Stellaron Hunters, you will never know the pain of betrayal.

speaker: Kafka
line: ▶ (Trailblazer)... Come, join us on stage. In the "script," we are the most brilliant actors on the cosmic stage, and the focus will always be on you.

speaker: Kafka
line: All the bloodshed and cries beyond the screen are merely there to serve as the backdrop for the main characters. Together, we will dance against the current, until the universe meets the Finality.

speaker: Sam
line: ▶ Let's dance, (Trailblazer).

speaker: Silver Wolf
line: ▶ Let's dance, (Trailblazer).

speaker: Blade
line: ▶ Let's dance, (Trailblazer).

speaker: Kafka
line: ▶ Let's dance, (Trailblazer)!

speaker: Silver Wolf
line: Ugh, why do I have to be the standby support again? So boring...

speaker: Mem
line: Battle... Companions, together!

speaker: Silver Wolf
line: Hack successful. Condition recovered!

text: (Enhance Blade with Mem's Lemme! Help You! for the first time)

speaker: Blade
line: It's time to clean up...

speaker: Silver Wolf
line: Take this. System crash!

speaker: Blade
line: Savor it? You're unworthy!

text: (Enhance Kafka with Mem's Lemme! Help You! for the first time)

speaker: Kafka
line: Leave no survivors... Right?

speaker: Silver Wolf
line: It's all about that adrenaline rush!

speaker: Kafka
line: The melody of slaughter, how beautiful.

text: (Enhance Trailblazer with Mem's Lemme! Help You! for the first time)

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ We are... companions.

speaker: Silver Wolf
line: Stand still so I can beat you!

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ In this script... I am the main character!

text: (Enhance Sam with Mem's Lemme! Help You! for the first time)

speaker: Sam
line: ▶ (Trailblazer), let's dance together.

speaker: Silver Wolf
line: Blaming me for cheating? Hmph, ban my account if you dare!

speaker: Sam
line: Together, we shall... set the seas ablaze.

text:
(Wave 2:Voidranger: Reaver×2,Voidranger: Distorter×1,Voidranger: Eliminator×1)
(Wave 3:Voidranger: Reaver×2,Voidranger: Distorter×1,Voidranger: Trampler×1,Voidranger: Eliminator×1)

speaker: Mem
line: Victory, victory!

speaker: Mem
line: Mighty, companions!

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: Disappear, temporarily.

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: Memories, remain... Always.

text: I want to leave this place.

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: Leave... It's, time.

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: Memories, remain... Always.

speaker: Mem
line: Farewell. Time, there is.

speaker: Mem
line: Companions, regrets... Don't leave.

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ Kafka... and Firefly.

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ Who should I bid farewell to...?

text: Choose a Stellaron Hunter in the memory to bid goodbye

title: Step Description
content: In the nonexistent memory, (Trailblazer) actually received a glance fromFuli, theAeonofRemembrance. A marvelous creature appeared next to (him/her), perhaps a gift from Oronyx. (Trailblazer) seems a little... despondent, but thankfully (he/she) quickly regained composure.

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: There is very little time left to stay in this memory... Do you want to leave the chance of bidding goodbye to Firefly?

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: ▶ Oh, (Trailblazer), it's you.

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: We've successfully completed the "script" once again, right? It's always reassuring to have you by our side.

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: Is something the matter? I've never seen you look like this before.

children.text: I can't remember anything...
Have we really met before?
I don't want to meet you again.

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: What... does that mean?

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: What happened? I... I don't actually know whether I should ask you this question. But... I just wanted to express my concern, for my companion.

children.text: We seem to have traveled together before...
I have forgotten everything...
I don't understand what you're saying.

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: Is that so... Will this journey also be cut short suddenly?

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: But... it's okay. You being here means our paths are bound to cross again. You're alive, and I will continue living. The parting that has yet to happen will not be an eternal one.

children.text: We did reunite.

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: That's fantastic.

children.text: Meeting again... It will happen.

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: That's fantastic.

children.text: I have nothing more to say to you.

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: Hmm... There's no need to say anything. Your eyes have already given me an answer.

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: I'll try to forget this and lock it away in the depths of my memory... When the day of our parting comes, I'll treat your words as a promise for our reunion.

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: When the day we cross paths again arrives, I think... I'll pretend we've never met, and get to know you anew, as if starting all over.

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: I will also try my best to express my thoughts openly to you... Because right now, I'm still unable to do it.

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: A day worth waiting for. Two people — no longer accomplices, just two drifting souls in the cosmos — meeting and getting to know each other in the most ordinary way...

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: ...That is the greatest luxury that I can ever imagine.

children.text: It's time for me to leave, Firefly.
Farewell, nonexistent memory.

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: ▶ That's it, that look on your face is the (Trailblazer) that I know.

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: You're leaving, right? Because there's something important that you have to do... You always understand what's the most important.

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: ▶ Go, (Trailblazer). It doesn't matter if you forget everything... I shall engrave the promise of our second reunion in my heart on your behalf.

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: I hope that it'll be a beautiful night with shooting stars.

text: Need time to think about it.

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: There is very little time left to stay in this memory... Do you want to leave the chance of bidding goodbye to Kafka?

children.speaker: Kafka
children.line: ▶ (Trailblazer)... You're here.

children.speaker: Kafka
children.line: Once again, we've completed the "script" without a hitch.

children.speaker: Kafka
children.line: Has something happened? You look... vulnerable.

children.text: I don't remember anything...
We haven't met in quite a while.
Did you abandon me?

children.speaker: Kafka
children.line: ▶ You know that I'd never ever do that, (Trailblazer).

children.speaker: Kafka
children.line: Tell me what's on your mind. You're used to confiding in me by now, aren't you?

children.text: We seem to have traveled together before...
I have forgotten everything...
I have nothing more to say to you.

children.speaker: Kafka
children.line: I see... You have lost your "past" and are feeling very helpless.

children.speaker: Kafka
children.line: Unfortunately, I'm not Destiny's Slave and cannot peer into the future. I can neither fill the gaps in your memory nor tell you what we later experienced together.

children.text: We parted ways... and met again once more.

children.speaker: Kafka
children.line: That means I'll regain what I lost.

children.text: The scene of us meeting again... I still remember it.

children.speaker: Kafka
children.line: That means I'll regain what I lost.

children.text: I wish that I hadn't met you.

children.speaker: Kafka
children.line: Such cruel words... You must have gone through a lot afterward.

children.speaker: Kafka
children.line: But in the end, we will meet again, which also means... I'll regain what I lost.

children.speaker: Kafka
children.line: ▶ (Trailblazer), listen to me...

children.speaker: Kafka
children.line: I suppose, in that script I haven't yet read, you'll face plenty of danger and end up in dreadful predicaments.

children.speaker: Kafka
children.line: You'll probably also experience many wonderful things and find companions who feel like family — even if it's no longer with us, the Stellaron Hunters.

children.speaker: Kafka
children.line: You'll also embark on adventures beyond your wildest imagination. After all, you were born for adventure.

children.speaker: Kafka
children.line: There's only one thing that I want you to always remember: No matter where you go or which corner of the cosmos you may be, you will always be able to find a safe haven by my side.

children.speaker: Kafka
children.line: Patience may not be my virtue... But toward you, it is something that I will never lack.

children.text: It's time for me to leave, Kafka.
Farewell, nonexistent memory.

children.speaker: Kafka
children.line: ▶ Goodbye, (Trailblazer).

children.speaker: Kafka
children.line: When fate places you at a crossroads... make your choice boldly, and don't fear regret.

text: Need time to think about it.

children.text:
(ObtainTrailblazer (Remembrance)Trailblazer (Remembrance))
(UnlockJoint Forces: Trailblazer (Remembrance))
(UnlockAchievementMeet Yesterday Once More)
(UnlockAchievementFireflies in a Bottleif Firefly was chosen orBobbing Spider's Threadsif Kafka was chosen)

text: Share your "Non-Existent Memory" with Dan Heng

title: Step Description
content: We arrived at Oronyx's residence, but they refused to offer any assistance. In a desperate attempt to save Mydei, Phainon was preprared to take drastic measures. Just as the sword was being drawn, Oronyx's demeanor shifted upon noticing (Trailblazer).

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ▶ (Trailblazer), what happened?

text: How long did I pass out for?

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Pass out? What are you talking about?

text: That was such a long memory, it seemed like a completely different world...

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Long? What are you talking about?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: You were standing here motionless earlier. No matter how much we shouted, you didn't respond.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: It hadn't even been a full minute when...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ...This creature appeared.

speaker: Phainon
line: Such a unique animal. I think it's an animal? I have never seen anything like it before.

speaker: Castorice
line: What a cute little creature... Is it a gift from Oronyx ?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Fuli? Just now?

speaker: Phainon
line: Fuli... What's that?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Remember the Aeons that I spoke to you about on the way to Okhema? Fuli is one of them and presides over the path of Remembrance.

speaker: Phainon
line: Ahh... A god from the worlds beyond the sky. A miracle that is hard to see with the naked eye... Right?

speaker: Phainon
line: To earn the gaze of an Aeon, does that mean...

text: Mem says that they can help us.
It's time for us to deal with Nikador.

speaker: Mem
line: Titan, past... Foggy.

speaker: Mem
line: Collect. Past... Reappear.

text: We must collect the memories of Kremnos.
We have to recreate the past.

speaker: Phainon
line: You can understand what they are saying?

speaker: Phainon
line: Collect the memories and recreate the past... How can we do that? We don't have much time left.

speaker: Mem
line: Anxious, no need! I will. Teach you.

text: Mem will tell us what we have to do.
Let's follow them. We don't have any better ideas right now.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: If they truly are a creation of Fuli, or have some connection to that Aeon, I'm willing to believe they can wield a power greater than Oronyx 's Miracle

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Let's go, we need to follow them.

speaker: Castorice
line: Oronyx ... Have you fallen into a slumber?

speaker: Titan's Voice
line: *Titan's murmurs*

speaker: Castorice
line: I don't know who the "Mother" that you're referring to is, but...

speaker: Castorice
line: Thank you for all your hard work. If Titans can dream... May your dream be a sweet one.

text: As the mission has been completed, Tribbie arrives per your summons and brings you back to Okhema.
